ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class LightLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.LightLocalizer

  • public class LightLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that corrects odometer data by using tile lines to calculate offset from theoretical position.
    Author:
    Volen Mihaylov

      Method to fully localise its position
      void localizeX()
      X Coordinate correction method.
      void localizeXMid()
      Localizes along the x-axis, making sure to end up in the center of the tile.

      Y Coordinate correction method.

        public LightLocalizer()

    • Method Detail

      • fullLocalize

        public void fullLocalize(int type)
        Method to fully localise its position
        Parameters:
        type - integer to determine the type of localization to be done depending on robots location

      • roundDeci

        public double roundDeci(double x)

      • localizeXMid

        public void localizeXMid()
        Localizes along the x-axis, making sure to end up in the center of the tile.

      • localizeYMid

        public void localizeYMid()
        Localizes along the y-axis, making sure to end up in the center of the tile.

      • localizeX

        public void localizeX()
        X Coordinate correction method. Must be called when robot's Light Sensors are at a distance from the line of at maximum 2.5 times the distance between the light sensors and the front wheel axle

      • localizeY

        public void localizeY()
        Y Coordinate correction method. Must be called when robot's Light Sensors are at a distance from the line of at maximum 1.1 times the Tilesize
